intro: Ranunculus nipponicus var. japonicus, commonly known as the Japanese buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Japan. It features delicate, showy flowers with five to eight yellow petals and a central cluster of stamens. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with palmate leaves that are deeply divided. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and its historical use in traditional Japanese medicine.
